title: Cloud Management license
content:
The Cloud Management license enables the Cloud Management capability which offers the following functionality:

  • Design and Deploy (DND): DND enables you to create service designs and offerings, and automate the provisioning and management, of hybrid and multi-cloud resources. 
  • Cloud Cost Reporting: Cloud Cost Reporting enables you to monitor your cloud spending and simplify configuration with various cloud providers.

The menu visibility and functionalities available depend on the configured experience mode. For more information on how to configure the experience mode and the functionalities available, see Experience mode. 

You can assign a trial license or a license key to a tenant. Perform the following steps to create a trial license or upload a license key to a tenant. 

Create a trial license

Follow the below steps to create a trial license.

  1. Log in to the Suite Administration.
  2. From the main menu, click Licenses.
  3. Click   New.
  4. Select Cloud Management as the license edition. 
  5. Click Save.
  6. Add the license to the license pool. For more information, see the section Add to the license pool.
The trial license created has a fixed capacity of 500 license units with a validity of 90 days.

Upload the license key

  1. From the main menu, click Licenses.
  2. Click Upload licenses on the toolbar.
  3. Select the license mode.
  4. Click Choose File to select your Cloud Management license file.
  5. Click Import. You can get a preview of license information and licensable features.
  6. Click OK.
The license must be uploaded from the suite administration only and not from the Autopass interface. 
The Cloud Management license file looks like the following screenshot. The lockType.deviceID must be the same as the lock code that you get by clicking the Lock Code button from Suite Administration in your environment.


Add to the license pool

Licenses are aggregated in license pools, you can assign multiple licenses in the license pool to one tenant.

  1. From the main menu, select Licenses.
  2. Select one or multiple licenses and click Add to license pool.
  3. Select a license pool and click Add. Licenses with the same properties (mode, start date, end date, edition, and access type) are combined into one entry in the license pool and the capacities are summed.

Assign a license to a tenant

  1. From the main menu, click Tenants
  2. Go to the License tab. Select  Add, specify the license pool, and select the Cloud Management license. The license will be assigned to the tenant.
  3. For more information on how to deploy DND, see Create a tenant and Deploy DND.

Edit a license

  1. From the main menu, select Licenses.
  2. Click the license in the ID column to display the selected license.
  3. Click the tab you want to view or edit. See the License details below.
  4. Save the changes.

•    License information of production, non-production, or evaluation license is read from license key, only name and description can be edited.
•    After a trial license is added to license pool, mode and capacity can't be edited.

License details

  • General tab

    Field Description
    ID License ID.
    Mode

    Displays the license mode Values include:

    • Trial
    • Production
    • Evaluation
    • Non-Production
    Name Name of the license. If the license is a unit license, a "Unit" tag is displayed.
    Access type

    Access type:

    • Unit: This license is based on the number of resource units consumed by Cloud Management
    Edition

    License edition:

    • Cloud Management

    For information on modules available in each edition, see Licensing.
    Start date Start date of the license.
    End date

    End date of the license.

    The trial license created has a fixed validity of 90 days.
    Capacity The capacity of the license.
    The trial license created has a fixed capacity of 500 license units.
    Product number Identifier of the product activated by license.
    Feature Determines the licensable feature.
    Feature version Version getting from the license file. Only applicable to Production, Non-production, and Evaluation licenses.
    License pool Displays the license pool ID if this license is added to a license pool.
    Description Description of the license.

License status

You can change the license status between Active and Inactive manually when a license isn't added to the license pool.

Status Description
Active Only Active licenses can be added to the license pool.
Inactive Inactive licenses can't be added to the license pool.
Retired

The license status becomes Retired automatically when the license expires.

  • Retired licenses can't be added to a license pool.
  • Retired licenses can't be edited or deleted.

    Revoke a license

    1. From the main menu, click Tenants.
    2. Select the tab "Licenses".
    3. Select the license to be revoked and click Revoke. The license will be revoked and it will be removed from the licenses list.

    Once a trial license is revoked for a tenant associated with an account, you can't reassign a trial license to the tenant with the same tenant ID. 

    Delete a license

    The license must be deleted from the Suite Administration only and not from the Autopass interface. 
    • A production license can be deleted only if it has not been utilized.

    To delete a license, follow these steps:

    1. In Suite Administration, revoke the license from tenants if you have already assigned this license to tenants. 
    2. Go to Licenses, select the license that needs to be deleted. Select delete. The license will be deleted.


    License unit mapping

    The table below gives the license consumption for one unit of resource. For more details on the CI component, see UCMDB CI components for DND

    Resources Component type/
    Child components    		 License consumed for one unit of resource
    Operating System Instance Server  1
    Storage Nodes Storage volume 1
    Database service
    Middleware service
    Public cloud service    		 Database
    Database Resource
    Cloud Service
    Application server
    Web Server
    Load Balancer software
    AWS Resource
    Azure Resource
    WebService Resource    		 0.2
    Network Nodes Net Device 0.5
    Containers Docker container 0.2
    Edge Device/ IoT Nodes
         		 Edge Server 0.125

    The total license consumed is cumulative consumption for all the resources provisioned. 
    Example: If a subscription has 1 Operating system, 2 Network node, and 1 Database provisioned, the license consumed will be calculated as described in the table below. The total license units consumed will be 2.2
     

    Component type Quantity License unit consumed
    Operating system 1 1 * 1
    Network node 2 2 * 0.5
    Database 1 1 * 0.2
    Total license units consumed 2.2

    License unit consumption

    Common terms that you will come across in this section:

    Check-out - The resources have been provisioned for a subscription/design and the number of license units consumed will be subtracted from the available license units. 
    Check-in - The resources have been de-provisioned for a subscription/design and the number of license units computed will be added to the available license units.

    License unit consumption will be computed for the following lifecycle operations:

    Submit a request in Service Portal or deploy a design in DND

    Deployment is triggered when a request based on a DND aggregated offering is submitted in the Service Portal. The licensing units will be computed depending on the resources provisioned for a deployment.


    Cancel a subscription from Service Portal or cancel the deployment in DND

    When a subscription is canceled the license units are checked in. Even if the subscription cancellation fails all license units consumed for the instance will be checked in. 
     

    Subscription expires 

    When a subscription expires the resource units are checked in. 
     

    Modify subscription from Service Portal

    A subscription can be modified by one of the following action:

    • Modifying the resource property - When you modify the resource property, there is no change in the license unit consumed.
    • Modifying the number of resources – When you increase or decrease the number of resources for a subscription, the license unit consumption will be computed again depending on the resources provisioned or de-provisioned.
      Example: If you increase the number of servers from 4 to 6 or decrease it from 4 to 2, the license unit consumption will be computed again depending on the additional servers provisioned/de-provisioned.   

    License enforcement 

    License unit consumption will be enforced when you submit a new subscription request or modify an existing subscription by increasing the number the resources.
    If sufficient license units aren't available, the deployment will fail with an error Failed to checkout, no license available. The deployment failure and its details will be logged in the Deployment Operations page. To view the deployment operations page, from the main menu go to Run > Deployment Operations. For more information on how to troubleshoot failures, see Deployment Operations - Instance Management.
    You can cancel the failed subscription to check-in the license units. 

    You can also view the license unit consumption report in Autopass. For more details on how to view the report, see the section Suite level license consumption report.

    License expiration notification

    Log in to Suite Administration and go to Configurations. Go to the License expiration notification tab.  You can configure the number of days before which the notification should be sent to the tenant admin.

    License usage and consumption reports

    Cloud Management license reporting enables the administrators to view consolidated license usage and consumption reports at the tenant or suite level. 

    Tenant level license consumption report

    A tenant administrator can view the tenant-level license consumption report.

    To view the report:

    1. Log in to the system with tenant administrator credentials.
    2. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People. The Cloud Management license consumption report link will be available.
    3. Click the link to download the report. 
    4. The downloaded file will contain a maximum of 10,000 records or records that are 30 days old.
    5. The CSV file will contain the following details.
      1. Checkout Date
      2. Expiry date
      3. Capacity
      4. User Name
      5. Product
      6. Version
      7. Product Feature
      8. In use
      9. Checked-in time

    Suite level license consumption report

    A suite administrator can view the suite-level license consumption report in Autopass.

    You can view the license consumption report for the following types of licenses:

    • Cloud Management trial license
    • Production license
    In the Autopass portal, access only the Usage tab for Cloud Management license consumption details. It's not recommended to access and use the other tabs.

    View license consumption report for a Trial license

    1. Login to Autopass (https://<hostname>/autopass) using OMT Administrator login credentials.
    2. Go to the Usage tab and select INSTANT ON.
    3. The trial licenses will be listed based on tenant ID.
    4. Select the link corresponding to the tenant id to see the detailed license consumption report for the tenant.

    View license consumption report for a production license

    1. Login to Autopass (https://<hostname>/autopass) using OMT Administration login credentials.
    2. Go to Usage tab.
    3. Select the feature ID 101026 feature ID for Cloud management.
    4. In the Select Pool, select the tenant ID to view the license consumption details.

    Reconciliation

    Reconciliation job will run periodically to update license capacity for any license units which could not be checked-in during de-provisioning.
